name: Core
description: Shared components used by Firefox and other Mozilla software, including handling of Web content; Gecko, HTML, CSS, layout, DOM, scripts, images, networking, etc. Issues with web page layout probably go here, while Firefox user interface issues belong in the Firefox product. (More info)

name: Calendar
description: The Mozilla Calendar project (more info)

name: CCK
description: The Client Customization Kit, for corporate/organization rollouts (more info)

name: Directory
description: The Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) project (more info)

name: Grendel
description: The Grendel Java-based mail/news reader (more info)

name: MozillaClassic
description: For bugs about the Mozilla web browser before M3. You cannot file bugs in this component.

name: Webtools
description: For bugs in the tools that mozilla.org uses.

name: NSPR
description: The Netscape Portable Runtime - Mozilla's cross-platform portability layer (more info)

name: mozilla.org
description: The administration of the Mozilla Project and its servers (Website content bugs will belong in the www.mozilla.org product)

name: Rhino
description: An implementation of JavaScript in Java (more info)

name: Derivatives
description: Sometimes bugs are reported to Bugzilla which are really bugs in a product that is derived from Mozilla and should be reported elsewhere. When you find such bugs assign them to this product to nominate them for transfer to the proper bug database. You cannot file bugs in this component. Examples: AIM or Net2Phone bugs in Netscape 6.

name: Documentation
description:
Documentation for Mozilla users, developers
and web developers.

name: Tech Evangelism
description: For reporting web pages that need to be upgraded to support web standards and Gecko-based browsers. And for reporting add-ons that exhibit common problems that make Firefox run sub-optimally. (more info)

name: NSS
description: Network Security Services - a cross-platform security library (more info)

name: Mozilla Localizations
description: Translation, spelling and other errors in language packs and localized builds (more info)

name: JSS
description: Network Security Services for Java - a Java interface to NSS (more info)

name: Bugzilla
description:
The Bugzilla bug-tracking system.
Note: This is not the place to request configuration, permission, or account changes to this installation of Bugzilla (bugzilla.mozilla.org). File such changes under the appropriate component in the bugzilla.mozilla.org product.

name: Camino Graveyard
description: Camino is a native Mac OS X browser-only project (more info)

name: Firefox
description: For bugs in Firefox Desktop, the Mozilla Foundation's web browser. For Firefox user interface issues in menus, bookmarks, location bar, and preferences. Many Firefox bugs will either be filed here or in the Core product. Bugs for developer tools (F12) should be filed in the DevTools product. (more info)

name: Marketing
description: Marketing and business-related ideas and projects (more info)

name: Thunderbird
description: Email client originally developed by the Mozilla Foundation and now maintained by its community. (more info)

name: Minimo
description: Browser for limited resource devices (more info)

name: SeaMonkey
description: An all-in-one internet application suite, including web browser, e-mail and newsgroup client, and HTML composer. (more info)

name: Composer
description: Next-generation gecko-based standalone HTML/XHTML authoring tool

name: Other Applications
description: For bugs in CCK, Chatzilla, DOM Inspector, Venkman, and other applications which aren't large enough to warrant an entire Bugzilla product.

name: Toolkit
description: The Mozilla Toolkit is a set of APIs, built on top of Gecko, which provide advanced services to XUL applications. These services include Profile Management, Chrome Registration, Browsing History, Extension and Theme Management, Application Update Service, and Safe Mode. (More info)

name: addons.mozilla.org
description: For security bugs ONLY for addons.mozilla.org. All other issues should be filed on github at https://github.com/mozilla/addons.

name: AUS Graveyard
description: The Application Update Service is used by client software to check for updates to application software.

name: Websites
description: For issues with content of Websites managed by Mozilla that do not have their own Bugzilla products.

name: developer.mozilla.org
description: For bugs and requests related to management of MDN Web Docs, and for bugs and requests related to the Kuma platform that drives the MDN wiki. Report issues about the MDN content under 'Developer Documentation'.

name: Testopia
description: Testopia is a test case management system that sits on top of Bugzilla.

name: Penelope
description: Eudora meets Thunderbird (more info)

name: Mozilla Labs
description: For bugs and requests related to management of Mozilla Labs and related projects.

name: Mozilla Metrics
description: Internal Mozilla Corp. database to house statistical/market data

name: support.mozilla.org
description: For bugs and requests related to management of SUMO, sometimes known as support.mozilla.org.

name: Tamarin
description: Next-generation JavaScript 2 virtual machine (more info)

name: Extend Firefox Graveyard
description: For issues related to the Extend Firefox contest, web site, etc.

name: Firefox for Android Graveyard
description: Old, retired Fennec bugs. Fennec is the code name of the effort to build a mobile version of Firefox (more info)

name: Testing
description: For bugs related to automated testing of Mozilla client code (Firefox, Thunderbird, Fennec, Gecko, etc) (More info)

name: Mozilla Messaging
description: The administration of Mozilla Messaging and its servers (Website content bugs will belong in the Websites product)

name: Core Graveyard
description: Old, retired Core components

name: MailNews Core
description: Mail and news components common to Thunderbird and SeaMonkey

name: quality.mozilla.org
description: For issues relating to the quality.mozilla.org website, also known as QMO.

name: Skywriter
description: Mozilla Skywriter is a product, designed in Mozilla Labs, that proposes an open, extensible, web-based framework for code editing that aims to increase developer productivity, enable compelling user experiences, and promote the use of open standards.

name: MailNews Core Graveyard
description: Old, retired MailNews Core components

name: Cloud Services
description: For bugs in Firefox Sync, Firefox Home, metrics, Server, Share, and other services. (more info)

name: support.mozillamessaging.com Graveyard
description: For bugs and requests related to management of the Mozilla Messaging "Knowledge Base (KB)"- known as "SuMoMo." Thunderbird support forum.

name: Community Building
description: For bugs about Community Building Working Groups, Partnerships and local communities.

name: Servo
description: Servo Project

name: Webtools Graveyard
description: Old, retired Webtools

name: External Software Affecting Firefox
description: For problems with third-party software which affect Firefox users. Plugin problems should be in Core:Plug-Ins instead of this product.

name: Websites Graveyard
description: Old, retired Websites

name: Add-on SDK
description: The software development kit for building Firefox add-ons. More info at: Jetpack project documentation.

name: Mozilla QA
description: For bugs and requests related to management of Mozilla QA related projects.

name: Toolkit Graveyard
description: Old, retired Toolkit components

name: Mozilla Labs Graveyard
description: Old, retired Mozilla Labs projects. Some products may have graduated to other places.

name: Mozilla Grants
description: Grants from the Mozilla Foundation.

name: Mozilla Reps
description: The Mozilla Reps, or ReMo, program provides a simple framework and specific tools to help volunteer Mozillians become official representatives of Mozilla in their region.

name: Web Apps
description: Web Apps are applications that run on any device, and can be distributed through any store or directly by the developer.

name: bugzilla.mozilla.org
description: For issues relating to the bugzilla.mozilla.org website, also known as BMO.

name: Input
description: Input is the feedback tool for Firefox.

name: Pancake
description: Pancake is a Mozilla Labs project using search and navigation history.

name: Snippets
description: The about:home snippet service is a simple, highly-cached content management service. It is intended to assemble and deliver content snippets to the about:home page in Firefox. The content delivered is determined by details about the installation of Firefox requesting content - including mainly details about the browser's build, locale, platform, and distribution channel, but not the person using the browser.

name: Firefox for Android
description: Firefox for Android is a mobile version of Firefox for Android devices. (more info)

name: Participation Infrastructure
description: Suite of tools that helps make it easier for people to get involved in the Mozilla Project.

name: Socorro
description: For issues with the Socorro server which accepts and processes Breakpad crash reports.

name: Firefox OS
description: FirefoxOS, or Boot2Gecko (B2G) is Mozilla's operating system built on web standards. (more info)

name: Air Mozilla
description: The Air Mozilla site (http://air.mozilla.com) and supporting infrastructure, including video conferencing. More info: Air Mozilla wiki page

name: Data Compliance
description: Tracking issues regarding handling of user data for maximal user benefit, in accordance with our privacy principles. (More info)

name: Untriaged Bugs
description: For newly filed bugs that need some help finding the right place to go. Help the bugmasters triage these!

name: Tracking
description: For tracking bugs that cross multiple products and services

name: Petri
description: Petri is a Mozilla PaaS/IaaS experimental project.

name: Mozilla QA Graveyard
description: Old, retired Mozilla QA components

name: Other Applications Graveyard
description: Old, retired Other Applications components

name: Marketplace
description: Mozilla's website (marketplace.firefox.com) to bring personalized discovery, worldwide distribution, and easy payments to the largest platform for app development: the Web. (more info)

name: mozillaignite
description: Mozilla Ignite is joint project with the National Science Foundation (NSF) to help people make apps that improve people's lives.

name: Webmaker
description: The Mozilla Foundation's project to build a generation of web makers (More info)

name: Privacy
description: Privacy and policy, including privacy reviews, data data release proposals, and modifications to privacy policies. Not for bugs and feature requests in software.

name: www.mozilla.org
description: For issues with content on www.mozilla.org http servers (but not the functioning of the servers) (more info)

name: Firefox Graveyard
description: Old, retired Firefox components

name: Firefox for Metro
description: Firefox for Windows 8 Touch (formerly Metro) is Mozilla's version of Firefox for the Windows 8 touch interface included in Firefox Desktop on Windows 8 and higher. (more info)

name: L20n
description: Next-generation localization architecture (more info)

name: Datazilla
description: Datazilla is a system for managing and visualizing application performance data.  The project includes a database, web service, and several user interfaces.  The source code repository, https://github.com/mozilla/datazilla/, and documentation, http://datazilla.readthedocs.org, can be found at these locations.  The primary project data managed by datazilla includes Talos performance data.  Datazilla web services for individual projects are deployed at specific uri paths: https://datazilla.mozilla.org/stoneridge/ (stoneridge project) and https://datazilla.mozilla.org/talos/ (talos project).

name: Developer Documentation
description: Requests for new developer documentation or for corrections to existing developer documentation on the MDN Web Docs wiki. Report issues about the MDN wiki platform under 'developer.mozilla.org'.

name: support.mozilla.org Graveyard
description: Old, retired suppport.mozilla.org components

name: Hello (Loop)
description: Firefox Hello, formerly called Loop, uses WebRTC to add real-time communications to the user's web browsing experience.

name: Android Background Services
description: Native Android services, including those bundled with Fennec. (More info)

name: Internet Public Policy
description: The Mozilla Internet Public Policy group works to build products that make the Web more robust and take action when the web’s DNA is threatened.

name: Firefox Health Report
description: For all bugs involving collection, submission, analysis and user-facing features (about:healthreport) as part of the Firefox Health Report product. (More info)

name: Developer Ecosystem
description: The products, tools, services, and resources used to equip and support our Mozilla Developer Ecosystem.

name: Boot2Gecko Graveyard
description: For bugs in old components that aren't active anymore.

name: Infrastructure & Operations
description: Server and networking infrastructure, including web properties, CDN, DNS (more info)

name: Mozilla Foundation Communications
description: The Mozilla Foundation runs programs like Mozilla Webmaker, Open Badges, Open News and more.

name: Release Engineering
description: For bugs related to all aspects of Mozilla's Release Engineering pipeline, including branded releases, continuous automation, release automation, tools, repos and hooks, machine issues, loaner machines, buildbot.

name: Developer Engagement
description: For requests related to Mozilla's Technology Evangelism group within Developer Engagement. Includes requests for events, outreach and demos (more info).

name: Mozilla Localizations Graveyard
description: Old, retired "Mozilla Localizations" components.

name: Data & BI Services Team
description: Data & BI Services Team provides data ingestion, processing and storage services, as well as BI consulting, dashboarding, reporting and custom visualization services for consumers of Mozilla product, people and business data.

name: Instantbird
description: This is the user interface of Instantbird. http://www.instantbird.com/

name: Chat Core
description: This is the core/back-end of Instantbird and Thunderbird chat (all code in the chat/ directory). This includes the JavaScript protocol implementations, our custom protocols that are not part of libpurple, and the purplexpcom library which allows the use of libpurple from scriptable  XPCOM (XUL/JS).

name: Instantbird Servers
description: *.instantbird.org and *.instantbird.com websites.

name: Powertool
description: Powertool is a set of software and hardware tools to allow developers to measure power consumption on Firefox OS phones. (more info)

name: Intellego
description: A machine translation project for the benefit of Mozilla and the Open Web (more info).

name: Mozilla Foundation
description: Bugs specific to the Mozilla Foundation.

name: Tree Management
description: Dashboards & tools to help manage commits to Firefox & Gecko related version control repositories and monitor the effect they have on code & test health.

name: Plugin Check
description: Plugin Check is a service that allows users to determine whether their plugins are up to date, out of date or vulnerable, and is accessible via http://mozilla.org/plugincheck

name: Invalid Bugs
description: For bugs reports that we are marking INVALID and don't belong in legitimate products and components. Moving bugs to this product will allow them to stop showing up in a valid product's search results and statistics.

name: addons.mozilla.org Graveyard
description: Old, retired addons.mozilla.org components

name: mozilla.org Graveyard
description: Old, retired mozilla.org components

name: Developer Services
description: For issues related to the services and infrastructure that support developer productivity: hg.mozilla.org, git.mozilla.org ([https://wiki.mozilla.org/DeveloperServices more info])

name: Localization Infrastructure and Tools
description: Tools, libraries and automation involved in Mozilla's localization processes

name: Content Services Graveyard
description: For bugs in Classification Engine, Interest Dashboard, Recommendations, Subscribe 2 Web, Tiles, and other services. (more info)

name: Firefox for iOS
description: Firefox for iOS is the Firefox mobile experience developed for the iOS platform.

name: FSA Graveyard
description: Firefox Student Ambassadors is a volunteer program for university students who are passionate about Mozilla, the open web, and the many benefits of Firefox and its products.

name: Tree Management Graveyard
description: Old, retired Tree Management components

name: Tech Evangelism Graveyard
description: Old, retired "Tech Evangelism" components

name: Testing Graveyard
description: Old, retired "Testing" components

name: Firefox Friends
description: Firefox Friends is a word of mouth marketing program that amplifies our marketing efforts by arming our broad community with the tools to become Firefox Friends.

name: Taskcluster
description: Taskcluster is a platform that Mozilla has developed for running tasks.  This product is for bugs with the Taskcluster platform itself, not for issues with the configuration of the Mozilla Taskcluster instance.

name: Enterprise Information Security
description: For Security incidents, investigation, risk analysis requests, reviews. The team formerly known as OpSec and currently known as EIS or infosec

name: Infrastructure & Operations Graveyard
description: Old, retired Infrastructure & Operations components.

name: B2GDroid Graveyard
description: B2GDroid is a project that let us run b2g on android devices as a homescreen. It uses code from both android and b2g, along with additional custom code.

name: Data & BI Services Team Graveyard
description: Data & BI Services Team provides data ingestion, processing and storage services, as well as BI consulting, dashboarding, reporting and custom visualization services for consumers of Mozilla product, people and business data.

name: Firefox Affiliates Graveyard
description: Old, retired Firefox Affiliates components

name: Focus-iOS
description: Focus by Firefox is a browser and content blocker for Safari that improves the privacy and performance of your mobile browsing experience by blocking analytics, social and advertising trackers (more info).

name: Enterprise Information Security Graveyard
description: For Security incidents, investigation, risk analysis requests, reviews. The team formerly known as OpSec and currently known as EIS or infosec

name: MozReview
description: Mozilla's installation of Review Board and related systems for tracking and managing code review.

name: Connected Devices
description: Connected Devices is Mozilla's effort to extend the Open Web to the Internet of Things (more info).

name: Plugins Graveyard
description: For problems with third party plugins (NPAPI), AntiVirus applications and Firewalls. This product is for enabling collaboration between mozilla.org and third party software vendors. Vendors will be recognized, and able to mark bugs as fixed with references to their software versions.

name: Shield
description: System to execute experiments, self-repair, and surveys in Firefox

name: Cloud Services Graveyard
description: Old, retired components for Cloud Services.

name: Firefox Health Report Graveyard
description: Old, retired Firefox Health Report components

name: Socorro Graveyard
description: Graveyarded components for Socorro server which accepts and processes Breakpad crash reports.

name: Web Compatibility Tools
description: A place to file bugs as they relate to software that deals with web compatibility (more info). Note: site and outreach bugs should be filed in Tech Evangelism.

name: Participation Infrastructure Graveyard
description: Suite of tools that helps make it easier for people to get involved in the Mozilla Project.

name: Input Graveyard
description: Input is the feedback tool for Firefox.

name: Conduit
description: Project Conduit.

name: Data Platform and Tools
description: Bugs for Telemetry Components

name: support.mozilla.org - Lithium
description: For issues support.mozilla.org on the lithium platform

name: Context Graph
description:
Context Graph is a recommender system for the Web. The goal for Context Graph features is to help people find new stuff based on their current context. This project includes several ongoing research projects related to the Web's morphology, client interactions with the Web, and Web content.
https://wiki.mozilla.org/Context_Graph

name: Pocket
description: Pocket and the Pocket API

name: Firefox Build System
description: All the stuff related to the build system and associated automation

name: Focus
description: Security bugs in the Focus mobile clients. All other bugs should be filed in github (more info).

name: Emerging Markets
description: For security bugs ONLY for Emerging Market Group projects. All other issues should be filed on github at https://github.com/mozilla-tw

name: DevTools
description: For bugs in Firefox DevTools, the developer tools within the Firefox web browser. This includes issues about the user interface of the toolbox, special pages such as about:debugging and about:devtools, and developer-related APIs.

name: www.mozilla.org Graveyard
description: For issues with content on www.mozilla.org http servers (but not the functioning of the servers) (more info)

name: WebExtensions
description: File feature requests and bugs related to the WebExtension add-on API.
